title-group.article-title: LA CAISSE NATIONALE D'EPARGNE ET LA MOBILISATION DE L'EPARGNE RURALE DANS LA REPUBLIQUE CENTRAFRICAINE / THE CAISSE NATIONALE D'EPARGNE AND RURAL SAVINGS MOBILIZATION IN THE CENTRAL AFRICAN REPUBLIC

abstract.p: The technical aid recently given by FINAFRICA to the Caisse Nationale d'Epargne in the Central African Republic forms part of the initiatives undertaken in favour of the African countries involved in programmes of promotion and collection of savings. In Autumn 1973, a group of experts visited the country with the aim of studying the present problems of the Caisse Nationale d'Epargne and better measures to be taken in favour of the promotion and the collection of rural savings. The Author, one of the experts of the study group, first analyses the structural and operational features of the Caisse Nationale d'Epargne as well as its particular nature of postal savings bank, then underlines its most important organizational areas suggesting at the same time a more rational policy to promote savings. Special attention is devoted to the investments, in particular to those channelled towards the Banque Nationale de Développement. At present the latter is facing a very difficult financial situation because of the very high rate of insolvencies in the loans granted to the agricultural sector, and this fact is also affecting the liquidity situation of the Caisse Nationale d'Epargne. Great efforts are now made to organize better the Banque Nationale de Développement, to create a new efficient agricultural credit institute, and to give a new operational feature to the Caisse Nationale d'Epargne aiming at an improved promotion of rural savings and a higher productivity of investments.
